intro: Blainvillea tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed blainvillea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, cylindrical stems and small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
